div.div: Φοίνῑκες : the Phoenicians, inhabitants of Phoenicia, their chief city Sidon. They appear in Homer as traders, skilful in navigation, famous alike for artistic skill and for piracy, Il. 23.744, Od. 13.272, Od. 14.288, Od. 15.415, 419, 473.
From A Homeric Dictionary (Georg Autenrieth, New York, Harper and Brothers, 1891)
